00026 #ifndef MIN_ENGINE_API_H
00027 #define MIN_ENGINE_API_H
00028 
00029 #include <dllist.h>
00030 
00031 /* ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00032  * INCLUDES 
00033  */
00034 /* ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00035  * CONSTANTS
00036  */
00037 /* ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00038  * GLOBAL VARIABLES
00039  */
00040 /* ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00041  * MACROS
00042  */
00043 #define MINAPI_PLUGIN_CALL(fname,fcall) \
00044         do { \
00045                 DLListIterator it = dl_list_head(get_plugin_list()); \
00046                 while (it!=DLListNULLIterator) { \
00047                         if ( ((eapiIn_t*)dl_list_data(it))->fname ) { \
00048                                 ((eapiIn_t*)dl_list_data(it))->fcall; \
00049                         } \
00050                         it = dl_list_next(it); \
00051                 } \
00052         } while(0);
00053 /* ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00054  * DATA TYPES
00055  */
00056 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00057  * FORWARD DECLARATIONS
00058  */
00059 /* ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00060  * Structures
00061  */
00062 
00064 typedef struct  {
00065 
00066         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00067         ** MIN engine calls this for every new test module it instantiates.
00068         ** The module_id uniquelly identifies the test module.
00069         */
00070         void (*new_module) (char *modulename, unsigned module_id);
00071 
00072         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00073         ** In case of error loading a module MIN engine calls this one.
00074         */
00075         void (*no_module) (char *modulename);
00076 
00077         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00078         ** MIN engine calls this when all the test cases found from test module 
00079         ** identified by module_id are reported (with new_case())
00080         */
00081         void (*module_ready) (unsigned module_id);
00082 
00083         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00084         ** Each test case found from test module. The module_id identifies the 
00085         ** test module, case_id is unique within the test module.
00086         */
00087         void (*new_case) (unsigned module_id, unsigned case_id, 
00088                           char *casetitle);
00089         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00090         ** MIN engine reports each started test case. The test_run_id 
00091         ** identifies the test run. The identifier is to be considred valid 
00092         ** while test case is running (ongoing/paused).   
00093         */
00094         void (*case_started) (unsigned module_id, unsigned case_id, 
00095                               long test_run_id);
00096 
00097         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00098         ** MIN engine reports that a test case identified with test_run_id has
00099         ** been paused.
00100         */
00101         void (*case_paused) (long test_run_id);
00102 
00103         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00104         ** MIN engine reports that a test case identified with test_run_id has
00105         ** been resumed.
00106         */
00107         void (*case_resumed) (long test_run_id);
00108 
00109         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00110         ** MIN engine reports test case result.
00111         ** Values for result as in TPResult (min_common.h)
00112         */
00113         void (*case_result) (long test_run_id, int result, char *desc,
00114                              long starttime, long endtime);
00115 
00116         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00117         ** Prints from test case (tm_printf()) are reported by this function. 
00118         */
00119         void (*module_prints) (long test_run_id, char *message);
00120 
00121         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00122         ** Lists all *.so seen in the MIN engine search paths.
00123         */
00124         void (*test_modules) (char* modules);
00125 
00126         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00127         ** Lists all text files seen in the MIN engine search paths.
00128         */
00129         void (*test_files) (char* modules);
00130 
00131         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00132         ** Engine reports fatal errors
00133         */
00134         void (*error_report) (char* error);
00135         
00136         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00137         ** Send RCP
00138         */
00139         void (*send_rcp) (char *cmd, char *sender, char *rcvr, char* msg, 
00140                           int param);
00141 
00142 } eapiIn_t;
00143 
00145 typedef struct {
00146         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00147         ** Adds a new test module to MIN. Engine calls new_module() if the 
00148         ** adding is succesfull.
00149         ** returns 0 if the async operation was started succesfully
00150         **         1 in case of error
00151         */
00152         int (*add_test_module) (char *modulepath);
00153 
00154         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00155         ** Adds a test case file to the test module identified by moduleid. 
00156         ** Note: This must be called at least once for every module added(
00157         ** with add_test_module()), with the testcasefile parameter as "\0". So
00158         ** that engine knows not to expect any more files. 
00159         ** returns 0 if the async operation was started succesfully
00160         **         1 in case of error
00161         */
00162         int (*add_test_case_file) (unsigned moduleid, char *testcasefile);
00163 
00164         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00165         ** Signals engine to start executing test case with caseid from module 
00166         ** with moduleid. If the groupid is non-zero test case is started when
00167         ** there are no cases running with the same groupid. (sequential
00168         ** execution)
00169         ** returns 0 if the async operation was started succesfully
00170         **         1 in case of error
00171         */
00172         int (*start_case) (unsigned moduleid, unsigned caseid, 
00173                            unsigned groupid);
00174         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00175         ** Pause test case
00176         ** returns 0 if the async operation was started succesfully
00177         **         1 in case of error
00178         */
00179         int (*pause_case) (long test_run_id);
00180 
00181         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00182         ** Resume test case
00183         ** returns 0 if the async operation was started succesfully
00184         **         1 in case of error
00185         */
00186         int (*resume_case) (long test_run_id);
00187 
00188         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00189         ** Abort test case
00190         ** returns 0 if the async operation was started succesfully
00191         **         1 in case of error
00192         */
00193         int (*abort_case) (long test_run_id);
00194 
00195         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00196         ** Reports fatal error to engine
00197         ** returns 0 always
00198         */
00199         int (*fatal_error) (const char *what, const char *error_string);
00200 
00201         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00202         ** Open interface towars the MIN engine
00203         ** returns number of available modules 
00204         */
00205         int (*min_open) ();
00206 
00207         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00208         ** Close the interface
00209         ** returns 0 on success 1 on error
00210         */
00211         int (*min_close) ();
00212 
00213         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00214         ** Triggers sending a list of test modules ( test_modules() )
00215         ** returns 0 on success 1 on error
00216         */
00217         int (*query_test_modules) ();
00218 
00219         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00220         ** Triggers sending a list of test files ( test_files() ) 
00221         ** returns 0 on success 1 on error
00222         */
00223         int (*query_test_files) ();
00224         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00225         ** Send RCP messages towards the engine
00226         ** returns 0 on success 1 on error
00227         */
00228         int (*receive_rcp) (char *message, int length);
00229         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00230         ** Register slave device
00231         **
00232         ** returns 0 on success 1 on error
00233         */
00234         int (*register_slave) (char *host, char *slavetype);
00235         /* --------------------------------------------------------------------
00236         ** Signals engine to start executing test case with caseid from module 
00237         ** with moduleid. Just before case is started a debugger is attached 
00238         ** to it. returns 0 if the async operation was started succesfully
00239         **                1 in case of error
00240         */
00241         int (*debug_case) (unsigned moduleid, unsigned caseid);
00242 
00243 } eapiOut_t;
00244 
00245 /* ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00246  * FUNCTION PROTOTYPES
00247  */
00248 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00249 void eapi_init (eapiIn_t *in, eapiOut_t *out);
00250 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00251 DLList* get_plugin_list();
